title: .NET/C# Software engineer
description:
.NET/C# Software engineer

Brummen, 40 uur per week

Ben je bekwaam in het ontwikkelen van front- en backend applicaties? Wil je graag de puzzels oplossen die binnen frameworks voorkomen? Wil je meewerken aan de informatiebeveiliging van onze vitale infrastructuur in Nederland? Wegens groei van de organisatie zijn we op zoek naar meerdere collega’s. Dus ben je een junior-, medior-, of senior engineer? Reageer dan zeker en wie weet ben je onze nieuwe collega in 2021 als .NET/C# Software engineer.

Wat ga je doen

Bij Tedas staat het verbeteren en implementeren van digitale weerbaarheid van onze klanten in de vitale infrastructuur voorop. Vanuit je rol als .NET/ C# Software engineer ga je je vooral bezighouden met ons eigen framework Fusion. Samen met je collega’s verbeter je en pas je daar waar nodig de verschillende front- en backend applicaties aan zodat we een optimale informatiebeveiligingsstructuur aanbieden en in stand houden. Met je collega’s denk je actief mee aan de ontwikkeling van ons framework Fusion. Met jouw actuele kennis van de nieuwste technieken kunnen we het framework nog beter maken. Onderdeel van de rol is ook het ondersteunen van andere afdelingen bij de verschillende werkzaamheden. Als IT-organisatie werken we zoveel als mogelijk binnen elk team volgens de Scrum-methode.

Wat breng je mee

  • Enthousiasme, ondernemerschap, vermogen om zaken te analyseren en ook op te lossen en natuurlijk humor.
  • (Ruime) kennis op het gebied van C#, .NET en microservices.
  • Ervaring met middleware zoals AMQP.
  • Kennis en ervaring met Docker en React geeft je zeker een streepje voor.
  • Communicatief vaardig in de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, mondeling en schriftelijk.
  • Minimaal een relevante afgeronde hbo-opleiding.

Wat bieden we jou

  • Een werkweek van maximaal 40 uur per week.
  • Een bruto salaris tussen de € 3.000,- en € 4.000,- per maand.
  • 25 vakantiedagen per kalenderjaar.
  • 8% vakantietoeslag.
  • Deelname pensioenfonds Nationale Nederlanden.
  • Ruime reiskostenvergoeding woon-werkverkeer.
  • Wekelijks patat op vrijdag.
  • Vrij vanaf 15.00 uur op 5, 24 en 31 december.
  • Cursus- en opleidingsmogelijkheden.
  • Attentie op je verjaardag.
  • Verse Nespresso koffie.
  • ........Ga zo maar door.

Wie zijn wij

Werken bij Tedas betekent dat je substantiële meerwaarde levert aan de digitale weerbaarheid van onze klanten. Denk daarbij aan Defensie, Opsporings- en Inlichtingen- & Veiligheidsdiensten en leveranciers van de vitale infrastructuur. Tedas is een innovatief bedrijf waarin iedere medewerker zich bewust is van de maatschappelijke relevantie van onze activiteiten. Op dit moment zijn we met ruim 30 collega’s en is er ruimte voor meer collega’s.

Binnen Tedas heerst een informele en ontspannen sfeer waar in alle openheid wordt gecommuniceerd en waar mensen zich op hun gemak voelen. Een prima klimaat om onze doelstellingen te behalen.

Ons kantoor is gevestigd in Brummen en goed bereikbaar vanuit Ede-Wageningen, Arnhem, Amersfoort, Zwolle, Zutphen en Deventer. We werken met name volgens de Agile methode aan de verschillende applicaties en netwerken die we samen met onze eindklant ontwerpen en ontwikkelen.

Geïnteresseerd

Spreken niet alleen onze arbeidsvoorwaarden je aan, maar ook de inhoud van het werk dat je voor een veiliger Nederland gaat doen? Of wil je eerst nog meer informatie? Bel met Ellen Langelaar, teamleider, via telefoonnummer 06-12 12 04 83.

Wil je reageren op deze vacature? Mail dan je motivatie en cv naar werkenbij@tedas.nl. Reageren voor 15 januari 2021.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: CTO Co-Founder
description:
Want to lead our startup?

Have you launched your own business before, or are you looking to build your first venture? Do you have experience in software development, product design and entrepreneurship? Are you looking to create great products and shape technology? Maybe you’re a former developer or strong software lead with a passion to start your own company… We’d love to hear from you.

Launch Factory is a startup studio with a unique approach to launching great companies. We internally source and develop concepts for our future businesses, and then we recruit Founders to launch each new company. Our seven-week Founders Recruitment Process uses a combination of assessments, interviews, and work samples to evaluate Candidates’ abilities to lead a successful company.

How Does it Work?

  1. Apply as a candidate through our website
  2. Find a Co-Founder through your network or our co-founder search tools
  3. Select which of our vetted startup businesses you would like to pursue
  4. Deliver work samples related to your chosen company, spanning both technical product development and business planning
  5. Launch Factory will review your work samples and the highest achieving teams will move on through each week of the recruitment process
  6. Ultimately, one final team will be selected to launch each of our new startups!

Funding + Incubation

If your team is selected, you and your co-founder will become the official founders of whichever startup you chose to pursue in the recruitment process. Here are the benefits:

  1. Seed Capital - Launch Factory provides a $300k investment to each newly formed startup
  2. Compensation - Up to $100k of the seed capital can be used, per year, for founder compensation.
  3. Equity Stake - Equity is split equally among each Founder and Launch Factory, excluding set-asides.
  4. Advisors – Launch Factory provides a team of compensated advisors to each new startup.
  5. Incubation – You’ll have access to proven processes and tools to help founders operate efficiently.
  6. Space to Grow - Each new company is given office space to help you grow and develop your new team.

Program Details

You don’t need the next big idea, or be willing to take on a startup alone, to become a founder with Launch Factory.

We provide you with vetted startup ideas, seed capital, advisors, incubation, and office space so you can surround yourself with the right people for focus on execution from day one.

Take the leap into entrepreneurship and apply as a Candidate for our 2021 Founders Recruitment Process today! The application period ends on February 21st, 2021 at 11:59 PM (Pacific).

You can read more about the Founders Recruitment Process and apply on our website here: https://bit.ly/3nKOOqR

Alternate titles: founder, co-founder, cofounder, ceo, chief executive officer, coo, chief operating officer, cto, chief technology officer, cfo, chief financial officer, startup executive, president, vice president, product architect, software lead, software developer, full-stack developer, product manager, strategist, analyst, data scientist, sales & marketing lead, business development executive, program manager

title: Senior Integrations Developer - EU based
description:
Thrive with Agiloft

Are you an experienced Senior Integrations Developer who is successful, motivated, smart, energetic, and looking for a rewarding position in a growing, profitable, and dynamic company?

Agiloft is looking for professionals that thrive working with enterprises in multiple industries, with unique business challenges requiring sophisticated solution design.

Why Join Agiloft?

  • Agiloft was named as the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant.

  • Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years.

  • The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row.

  • Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization.

  • Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies.

  • Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.

As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards overachievement.

Position Overview

You will be a key member of the Agiloft engineering team responsible for delivering data integration projects. You will be actively engaged in all aspects of the solution lifecycle, including design, development, support, and ongoing maintenance. While there are many different applications and iPaaS platforms we integrate with, many of our customers need to integrate Agiloft with Salesforce. You will be a perfect fit for the open position if you also have experience with building or modifying Salesforce applications.

You should have no less than three years of professional experience in building enterprise-grade applications with a focus on integrations and API and one year plus experience with Apex applications. We expect you to be passionate about building software and perform well working in a geographically distributed and diverse team.

This is a remote-only position. You must be comfortable with setting your own schedule and proactively collaborating in a globally dispersed team using a variety of communication channels.

Job Responsibilities

  • Translating business requirements into technical requirements and developing the necessary integration or application to fulfill those requirements.
  • Code produced will primarily be, but is not restricted to, REST APIs and integration orchestrations.
  • Write Apex routines or modify existing Apex routines for Agiloft customers
  • Documenting code for maintenance and reusability.
  • Understanding existing code and performing maintenance and enhancements as required.
  • Working with other teams to promote standards and code reuse across the organization.

Required Qualifications

  • Java Developer
  • Web Services (REST & SOAP)
  • RESTful API design and JSON data representation
  • Experience with J2EE, Tomcat, JBoss, EJB3 is a plus
  • Experience in Multi-threading is plus
  • Relational databases
  • Experience with Salesforce Apex
  • Experience working in geographically dispersed teams
  • Bachelor’s Degree

Preferred Qualifications

  • Good understanding of current database technologies and their applications
  • Hands-on experience with building Salesforce applications
  • A keen interest to learn about new technologies
  • Fluent in the English language

Benefits and Perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Referral bonuses
  • Generous vacation and flexible work schedules
  • Professional development and career growth opportunities
  • Awesome team members

INTERESTED? APPLY NOW!

For a full list of open positions and to submit your application, go to our website http://www.agiloft.com/jobs.htm or apply directly here > agiloft.com/SrIntegrationDev

title: System Administrator
description:
Thrive with Agiloft

Are you an experienced System Administrator who is successful, motivated, smart, energetic, and looking for a rewarding position in a growing, profitable, and dynamic company?

Agiloft is looking for professionals that thrive working with enterprises in multiple industries, with unique business challenges requiring sophisticated solution design.

Why Join Agiloft?

  • Agiloft was named as the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant.

  • Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years.

  • The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row.

  • Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization.

  • Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies.

  • Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.

As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards overachievement.

Position Overview

This is a mission-critical position requiring a well-rounded administrator who is passionate about learning and taking advantage of the latest technologies.

You will be part of a team that is responsible for our Amazon AWS infrastructure design and migration, our KVM-based virtualized stack at a local data center, designing process improvements, network management, and administering the Linux servers used by our SaaS service, together with a handful of Windows servers (virtualized and on bare metal), along with the services they provide.

Required Qualifications

  • At least 4 years of full-time work experience as a system administrator; or a college degree and 2 years of full-time work experience as a system administrator. A College degree in Computer Science or an equivalent is a plus.
  • Experience with Linux, Windows, and Virtualization (KVM preferred).
  • Familiarity with IPv4 networking, including DNS, SMTP/POP/IMAP, HTTP, LDAP, SSH, and SQL.
  • Superior troubleshooting skills.
  • Willingness to participate in an on-call rotation schedule with the rest of the team.
  • Excellent judgment, capacity to independently evaluate situations, and identify the optimum course of action.
  • High intelligence and creativity.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bash, Perl, and/or Python scripting capabilities.
  • Knows the difference between vi and emacs and can use one of them expertly.
  • RBAC experience, such as SELinux, or GRSec.
  • Expertise in configuring an Asterix VOIP system.

Benefits and Perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Health and dental insurance
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Referral bonuses
  • Generous vacation and flexible work schedules
  • Professional development and career growth opportunities
  • Awesome team members

INTERESTED? APPLY NOW!

For a full list of open positions and to submit your application, go to our website http://www.agiloft.com/jobs.htm or apply directly here > agiloft.com/SysAdmin

Agiloft is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Agiloft is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination of any kind. All employment decisions at Agiloft are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or social ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental, or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union, or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history, genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

title: DeFi Tech Head  - XinFin[XDC] Network
description:
XinFin Network is an enterprise grade hybrid blockchain network with a live and stable public network since Mid 2019. XinFin Network is a partner of R3 corda network which is building bridge with the corda ecosystem. This architecture makes XinFin Network a true Hybrid blockchain ready for enterprise adoption.

Decentralised Finance is the next big thing in Blockchain and one of the strongest and successful use cases of Blockchain and Digital asset ecosystem. Analysts predict that DeFi will go on to power the entire financial markets which transaction 100 Trillion USD+ every year.

XinFin is looking for a DeFi Tech head who will lead the DeFi ecosystem on XinFin Network.

DeFi ecosystem on XinFin Network would consist of following :

  • Mint synthetic USD (xstable) stablecoin by collaterilsing XDC
  • Generate yield on (xstable) by staking it across lending ecosystem https://www.tradefinex.org/publicv/markets - this is where (xstable can lend)
  • Add support for SGDg and EURg in XinFin DeFi ecosystem (These are stablecoins by Globiance running on XDC Network)
  • Enable staking on SGDg and EURg
  • Smart contract for liquidity pools for (xstable)/SGDg and (xstable)/EURg
  • Actively involve community in testing DeFi contracts and ensure they have best UI for accessibility
  • Engage with Asset managers, fund managers, financial institutions, Digital asset/crypto exchanges, digital asset custodians who can offer the DeFi stack/protocol to their own customers

Main Features in DeFi project are :

  • Synthetic Assets - These token assets imitate a real world asset or digital asset by using its price feed
  • Decentralised Exchange : Such synthetic assets to be exchanged via decentralised exchange
  • Wrapped assets : Wrapped token assets are minted 1:1 with an actual peg to the asset, such as fiat money for stablecoins, gold, Bitcoin
  • Yield Farming : Yield farming contracts enable p2p users in choosing their own yield generating origination

Reference Projects :

  • https://www.synthetix.io/

  • https://compound.finance/

  • https://www.circle.com/en/usdc

  • https://www.paxos.com/pax/

  • https://fantom.foundation/defi/

  • https://pwawallet.fantom.network/

  • https://github.com/makerdao

You a fit if : You eat, live and breathe tech and code, especially github, gitlab

Location : Anywhere, Remote *** Please note this is a full-time onsite or remote position and no visa or relocation support will be provided.***

Employment Type Full-time

title: Front-End Engineer
description:
Simply put: Nebo’s engineering team gets things done. That usually looks like using the art of code to solve problems and build solutions for clients and coworkers alike. We don’t get hung up on what hasn’t been done — we’re all about what we can do. We’re looking for driven teammates who are ready to jump in and do the same.

About Nebo

Nebo is a human-centered agency committed to doing great work and never settling for "good enough." The culture is friendly, the work is rewarding and the Friday beers are cold, because that's the way we like it. Located in West Atlanta, we're at the heart of the Southeast's digital, startup, and marketing scenes. (We also have a stock of Red Bull, fuel of champions.)

About the position

As a front-end engineer at Nebo, you will bring well-designed website and interfaces to life with carefully crafted HTML and javascript.

Be prepared to work with our back-end, design, content and UX teams to maintain and develop features for existing web applications and websites and to build complex user interactions either from scratch or within existing frameworks.

We’re looking for someone with 2-5 years of professional coding experience and strong examples of previous work.

Here are some of the technologies we use on a daily basis

  • JavaScript / JQuery
  • CSS / Sass
  • Git / GitLab
  • Nebo CMS (our in-house Content Management System built and maintained by our team!)

Skills Required

  • Proficient in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Portfolio of designed and coded work
  • Familiar with Adobe creative tools
  • Able to translate user experience and design into clean, modular, and scalable code that follows web standards
  • Attention to detail
  • Good communication skills

The things that will set you apart (AKA Bonus Skills)

  • Familiar with using Git and version control
  • Experienced in SCSS, Grunt/Gulp
  • Agency or fast-paced work environment experience

This is a full-time position and compensation is dependent upon experience. We're currently working remotely due to COVID-19, but going forward this position will be based in our office located in Atlanta, Georgia.

Nebo's Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

As a human-centered agency, we believe in uplifting our community and advancing society through inclusive business practices. We're dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran’s status.

Thank you for your interest in Nebo!
how_to_apply: Email your resume to careers@neboagency.com or apply directly here.

title: Front End Engineer (Javascript)
description:
Intro

We are looking for an additional Front End Developer who can help us to build and improve our platform. If you like working in a fast-paced environment where you can really add value, this is the job for you!

We are accepting applications for the next two months and we fill the open position as soon as we’ve found the right candidate.

About the Position

Front End Engineer (Javascript)

These are the most important aspects you’ll be working on:

  • Implement complex components such as rich text editors that dynamically analyses what is written in them and enriches it.
  • Come up with sound architectures to support fast and rich web apps with hundreds of moving pieces.
  • Refactoring outdated pieces of code into something awesome.
  • Work in close collaboration with the development and design teams.

About Tolq

Tolq’s goal is to eliminate language barriers and to do that we’ve built a lot of technology that makes it easier for companies to translate their content. Our clients range from Bol.com, to MediaMarkt to Belvilla and many others

We have our HQ in The Hague in The Netherlands and we are remote first (so location is not an issue).

We have an open ‘startup-like’ mentality and are a software company from origin.

What else can you expect from us?

  • Enthusiastic and fun colleagues
  • Startup mentality and possibilities
  • Friday afternoon drinks and/or (theme)parties (when COVID allows)

You can expect a mindful onboarding process with ramp-up and time to learn. You can expect a team that listens, and to be heard. You can expect to give and provide direct feedback. You can expect to be counted on. You can expect to do your best work and build a career here.

About You

We are looking for someone who is ready for this challenge with a getting things done work spirit.

Skills

  • You are crazy about building beautiful and intuitive interfaces
  • You enjoy tough challenges
  • You are driven and enthusiastic
  • You can handle a fast-paced, ever-changing, and deadline-driven environment
  • Your communication skills in English are proficient

Experience

  • At least 2 years using React and Redux, good knowledge of its weakest points and how to avoid them.
  • At least 5 years of experience developing web applications
  • Experience with testing frameworks
  • Experience with GraphQL

Good to have

  • Ruby on Rails experience
  • UX design capabilities with special emphasis on usability.
  • Experience building SPAs from the ground up choosing a solid architecture fit for the problem.
  • Good capabilities solving hard CSS problems

How to Apply

You can apply via https://tolq.recruitee.com/o/front-end-engineer-javascript-den-haag Please send an application that speaks directly to how you would like to fill this position. There are no right answers or expectations. Show us your role in Tolq’s future and our role in yours. Address some of the work we do. Introduce yourself as a colleague. Feel free to respond in either Dutch or English.

Please do NOT apply for this position if you just did IronHack, Codaisseur or one of the other basic coding bootcamps - or apply as an intern.

title: Desktop Application Developer
description:
Desktop Application Developer

Our open platform enables mechanical engineers to fundamentally change their way of working. We are developing an application that accelerates the pace of innovation for our customers by providing them with the tools to model technical components using design algorithms and test simulations. Our desktop application allows its users to focus on the requirements of their components and leave repetitive redesign and evaluation to the application.

What you'll be working on

We are looking for a Desktop Application Developer to join our team. You will work on our application which allows the user to create, arrange and modify complex models as graphs. If you enjoy building Windows desktop applications and have a very good understanding of .NET, you are the perfect addition to our team!

  • Together with other developers you will add new functionality to our C# application while guarding and improving the architecture and functionality of the application.
  • You will be responsible for understanding how .NET applications work and for having a focus on performance.
  • Together with your team you will bring stories from a conceptual state to implemented in a release.
  • You will be an active team member of one of our multiple Scrum teams working on the same application, so collecting and sharing knowledge is an important part of your daily work.
  • If you also have knowledge of WPF and Direct2D, you will impress us even more!

Why ELISE

As a Startup we revolutionize the design process for 3D printing with our software. Do you love to work on cutting-edge projects for automotive, aviation and space industry? We are proud of our team - our people are excellent in what they do. We offer an exciting and varied work in the interdisciplinary field with a lot of creative freedom in a small, enthusiastic team. We care about personal growth and invest in the development of our employees. Together with you, we want to perfect our software and position it in a fast-growing, exciting market. Read more at: www.elise.de/company/career/.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, or related fields.
  • Extensive knowledge about all frameworks and tricks in the .NET world in combination with Windows Desktop Applications.
  • Proven experience in C# (or in similar languages).
  • Experience with WPF and/or Direct2D.
  • Experience with git or other modern version control systems.
  • A passion for robust development practices including test-driven development, continuous integration and agile methodologies.
  • Excited to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.
  • Preferred Qualifications.
  • Experience in C++ desirable.
  • Knowledge of computer aided design and/or finite element analysis desirable.
  • Knowledge of geometry processing libraries (e.g., Parasolid, Hoops, OpenVDB) desirable.
  • Interest in artificial intelligence preferable.

Are you up for the challenge?

We change the way product development works and are looking for a full time Desktop Application Developer (.NET) (m/f/d). Do you want to join? Apply now via the application form.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
Who is RecycleSmart:

A National B2B managed services firm that provides outsourced management of waste, organics and recycling to a broad range of industries across Canada. We do our part to ensure we make the world a better place! We are a dynamic, fast-paced, fun, collaborative environment where we value innovation while helping our teammates and customers grow. We get recognized for our successes (be sure to look at our company page).

What We Need:

You will be a product-focused full-stack engineer. You’ll join its remote development team and will work on an early-stage IoT product. Must be located in Canada.

RecycleSmart is developing an IoT product that helps garbage and recycling companies reduce carbon emissions and improve recycling performance. We’re looking for a senior engineer to join the Cloud software team. You’ll be responsible for ensuring the RecycleSmart Cloud stays up and running, building new features, and ensuring the Cloud team takes a sane technical approach. We’re a small team so you’ll be working closely with the firmware team, customers, and the product manager to build and ship software.

On the frontend you’ll work on our React SPA, and on the backend you’ll build RESTful APIs in Node/Express/Postgres.

What People say about You:

As a key member of our remote engineering team, you’ll lead the development of many high impact product initiatives. We’re looking for a strong engineer who works well on a small team and is excited about the opportunity to have a direct impact on improving customer experience.

What you will be doing:

  • Implement new features + functionality with RecycleSmart’s core product (Pello)
  • Build features on the frontend with React, Redux, and Javascript
  • Develop REST APIs with Node and Express that power the frontend SPA, ingest data from IoT devices, and push firmware updates to our IoT devices
  • Write migrations to support changes to our Postgres DB (we also use TimescaleDB to make it easier to work with time series data)
  • Be actively involved in product and architecture decisions
  • Collaborate with other remote engineers and participate in peer code reviews
  • Diagnose and fix bugs
  • Ensure the product stays up and running

Technologies:

  • Frontend: Javascript, React
  • Backend: Javascript, Node, Express
  • Datastores: Postgres, S3
  • Infrastructure: AWS: EC2, Elasticache, Cloudfront, Route53, etc
  • Misc: Git/Github, Jira

Is this You?

  • 6+ years experience building, deploying, and maintaining production web applications
  • 3+ years experience using AWS for deployment and hosting (we use EC2 and S3 and will almost certainly expand to other AWS services)
  • Experience building complex Single Page Applications
  • Experience writing, maintaining, and integrating REST APIs written in Node/Express
  • Experience working with and optimizing Postgres for fast query execution times
  • Experience leading nimble development initiatives requiring collaboration + coordination with fellow engineers
  • Enthusiastic about learning, working within, and architecting high impact products
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Desire to help grow a business with your technical skills

Why join RecycleSmart:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Extended Medical and Dental Benefits
  • GRSP program
  • Diverse and Inclusive team focused on supporting internal growth
  • Focus on giving back to the community

title: Manager, Software Engineering
description:
APPLY ONLINE AT: https://jobs.lever.co/thebouqs.com/8d9b0ca3-e718-4059-a468-8063978dc9b6

The Enterprise Engineering Manager contributes to The Bouq’s mission of creating a world‑class sustainable brand disrupting the global $50B floral industry by working to architect our next generation platform for logistics, planning and data mining that will enable our business to scale having a material impact on the future of our company. You will work directly with various business stakeholders to understand what is needed and be responsible for architecting, designing and developing updates to our service-oriented architecture and future microservices architecture. You will be working with a range of current and new technologies that will help drive our company’s growth. Along the way you will be empowered to use an amazing set of technologies that will help you and the team accomplish the job while providing mentorship to your team. You will be challenged with all of this while maintaining a high availability production environment and performing continuous deployments.

Responsibilities:

  • Partnering with business stakeholders in self organizing teams to architect, design, and develop new features for our enterprise back-end architecture.
  • Working with partnering technology and business teams to ensure rich capabilities are delivered with high functional and engineering quality, on an iterative basis.
  • Working closely with your team and other engineering leads, you will help conduct peer review of code and technical designs
  • You will be responsible for leading a small team of engineers where you will help them lead the execution of new initiatives, improvement of existing systems, and support of system maintenance and defect resolutions.
  • Will provide guidance and support to help your subordinates grow in their career path.
  • Support technology applications through their entire lifecycle.
  • Review platform performance and optimization across the enterprise system as needed
  • You will help support our current enterprise platform, while building out our future platform that will be high performant, scalable, and redundant.

Qualifications:

  • At least 8 years of professional development experience. Must have experience driving initiatives across full journey of SDLC
  • Production experience with Java applications and JVM application tuning
  • Experience with architecture, implementation, testing, deployment, support and troubleshooting distributed applications running in a cloud environment, preferably AWS
  • Experience with blocking and async application architectures
  • Experience with Message bus infrastructure (Kafka, SQS or Kinesis)
  • Relational data modeling experience as well as NOSQL experience, preferably with understanding of advanced concepts (query optimization, serialization, versioning, bulk operations)
  • Focus on writing idiomatic code
  • Strong awareness and proponent of unit and integration testing
  • Deep understanding in one or two technical areas but with a curiosity covering a wide range of topics.
  • Experience in agile software development (Scrum or Kanban)
  • A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
  • Highly motivated tech geek who is a self/quick learner with an amplitude to think outside the box.
  • Professional attitude towards your peers, as well as everyone in the organization
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate with different groups
  • Technical, thorough, and detailed oriented.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience with Spring / Spring Boot
  • Experience developing actor model applications in Scala using the Akka toolkit
  • Experience with Redis, Cassandra, MongoDB, or ElasticSearch
  • Experienced in practices of Continuous Integration/ Continuous Delivery
  • Experience with Docker / ECS / Kubernetes or other Containerization of services
  • Experience with Serverless Application Model for AWS including Lambda
  • Familiarity in the domain of Logistics or Enterprise Resource Planning or similar operational systems

Compensation:

  • Competitive Salary + Equity Package
  • Health, Dental & Vision with 100% employee coverage
  • Three Weeks Paid Vacation
  • Discounts on The World’s Best Flowers (obviously!)
  • Work on cutting edge new technologies
  • Cold brew coffee, beer on tap, and fully stocked state of the art kitchen with a fabulous indoor / outdoor lunch area.

About The Bouqs: Our mission here at The Bouqs is to revolutionize the way we commemorate life’s moments by connecting people to beautifully designed flowers and the responsible partners who create them. Grounded in transparency, responsibility, and simplicity, we create genuine moments of emotional connection for our customers, build meaningful relationships with like-minded farmers and florists while empowering them to thrive, and eliminate unnecessary waste along the way.

Founded in 2012, The Bouqs is a venture-backed online floral retailer that delivers flowers fresh from eco-friendly, sustainable farms to doorsteps nationwide. Headquartered in Marina Del Rey, CA, The Bouqs connects farms and a curated network of artisan florists directly to consumers and disrupts the traditional supply chain by eliminating overhead costs like warehouses, importers, distributors, auctioneers and more. In turn, this model enables a superior product and redefines the experience and economics for both consumers and producers alike.

For more information, visit www.bouqs.com and follow the #BouqLove on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

The Bouqs is an Equal Opportunity Employer!

title: Senior Java Software Engineer
description:
Senior Java Software Engineer

Atlantis Technology (atlantistech.com) is seeking talented engineers who want to help us build the future. We're not simply seeking coders; we're looking for individuals who are collaborative problem solvers that want to make a dent in the universe. Atlantis works on a variety of projects and products. These projects range from supporting financial institutions and life science companies, to building prototypes for small startups, to data harvesting, manipulation and discovery.

Here's where you come in:

If you're a well-rounded engineer that likes challenging and complex problems, and you enjoy being part of a tight-knit, collaborative group, Atlantis might just be the perfect fit for you! We're building out small, agile teams that directly contribute to big projects for our partners. Our engineers have a say in the development process, and work closely with our Product Managers and partners to build awesome, functional applications.

Skills and Requirements:

  • Ideal candidates have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields
  • Significant experience in Java (9+) development, preferably in a team environment
  • Managed projects hosted in AWS, leveraging a broad array of services (S3, EC2, Lambda, Elastic Beanstalk, etc.)
  • Experience contributing to Microservice based applications
  • You believe in test-driven development and actually implement it
  • Comfortable with being collaborative and agile
  • Ability to rapidly learn new technologies and apply them to make even better products
  • An engineering mindset. We're looking for problem solvers, not just code slingers

Extra Credit:

  • You have full-stack capabilities
  • You have developed, maintained and documented APIs
  • AWS Certifications
  • DevOps experience a plus
  • Understanding of DNS, TCP/IP, SMTP, HTTP and Distributed Networks
  • Love to learn
  • Have entertaining stories for the team

Why Atlantis?

We're a group of engineers, product managers and marketers who have been long-time colleagues and teammates. We love building products for our partners, and we love celebrating our successes with them. We're based in Concord, MA, just outside of Boston, MA. Once you're established with our team, there are flexible options for remote work and commuting. At Atlantis, we look to build life-long connections with our engineers.

title: Senior Web developer
description:
Senior PHP developer

Ben je op zoek naar een job waarin je uitdagende projecten mag doen, in een hecht team samenwerkt, veel vrijheid krijgt en aan eigen producten van het bedrijf werkt? Dan is werken bij Prezent Internet wellicht wat voor jou! Wij zijn op zoek naar ervaren PHP developer die het team komt versterken.

Prezent Internet bestaat uit een team van ervaren ontwikkelaars en wordt er gewerkt aan vooruitstrevende en uitgebreide applicaties. We zoeken iemand die goed binnen dit team past, zelfstandig projecten kan uitvoeren en ook  graag met nieuwe technologie aan de slag gaat.

Over ons bedrijf Prezent Internet is een internetbureau met meer dan 20 jaar ervaring op het gebied van software ontwikkeling, domeinregistratie en internationale online marketing. De kantoorlocatie is in het centrum van Tilburg.

Op het gebied van software ontwikkeling zet Prezent een aantal hoogwaardige SaaS oplossingen in de markt. Zo draait onze stagesoftware B3net bij tientallen MBO- en HBO-scholen in het hele land en is ons vacature portaal Careernet geïmplementeerd bij alle gemeentes in de regio Midden- en West-Brabant. We leveren daarnaast de e-commerce oplossing LogiVert aan honderden verkooporganisaties in Nederland en België. Tevens ontwikkelen we geavanceerde applicaties voor de agrarische industrie via ons partnerbedrijf AppsforAgri, en werken we aan IoT oplossingen inclusief de levering van hardware.

Stuk voor stuk zijn dit serieuze omvangrijke applicaties, waarin jij als ontwikkelaar continue wordt uitgedaagd.

Onze ideale kandidaat heeft:

  • Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding.
  • Grondige kennis van PHP, MySQL
  • Afdoende kennis van HTML, CSS en JavaScript.
  • Ervaring met Symfony en Doctrine.
  • Een gemotiveerde en ambitieuze instelling.
  • Een grote mate van zelfstandigheid waarbij hij losgelaten kan worden op de technische infrastructuur van webapplicaties.
  • Communicatieve vaardigheden.

Wat kun je verwachten?

  • Voldoende ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling: certificeringen, trainingen en conferenties.
  • Een passend salaris naar leeftijd, kennis en ervaring.
  • Afwisselende functie met ruimte voor eigen initiatieven.
  • Complexe uitdagingen en high performance maatwerk opdrachten.
  • Een inspirerende werkomgeving met een enthousiast en gedreven team.
  • Een dagelijks verzorgde lunch met al jouw collega’s, post Corona.
  • Mogelijkheden tot structureel thuiswerken.
  • Prettige werklocatie in het hartje centrum van Tilburg.

Goed gevoel? Neem contact op om kennis te maken! Dan gaan we samen onderzoeken of we een goede match zijn voor elkaar. Stuur je sollicitatie naar vacature@prezent.nl. Wil je meer informatie over de vacature, dan kun je ook contact opnemen met dhr. M. de Vree op 013-5802341.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Wil jij als Software Engineer bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling van innovatieve software die wordt ingezet om patiënten met kanker of hersenafwijkingen te behandelen?

Elekta is toonaangevend op het gebied van innovatieve apparatuur en software die ontwikkeld wordt om de levens van mensen met kanker en hersenaandoeningen te verbeteren, te verlengen en te redden. Daar zijn we trots op, maar zelfvoldaan zijn we zeker niet. Iedere dag opnieuw zijn we bij Elekta bezig met de ontwikkeling en het verbeteren van onze apparatuur en software. 

Zoek jij een baan met voldoening waarbij je ook volop ruimte krijgt om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen? Ter uitbreiding van ons software ontwikkelteam hebben we nu een vacature voor een 

Software Engineer

Veenendaal en thuis, 40 uur per week

Op dit moment zitten we volop in een software-transitie binnen Elekta, dus het is sowieso een interessant moment om nu in te stappen in ons team van zo’n 10 software en system engineers. De komende jaren zetten we onze software om naar nieuwe technologieën en bestaande producten worden klaargemaakt voor migratie. Het team is relatief klein en dat betekent dat je als een T-shaped Software Engineer bij een breed scala aan activiteiten betrokken zult zijn. Hierbij kijk je steeds proactief waar je kunt bijdragen aan de continue verbetering van onze software. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Software Development. Je taken zijn onder andere:

  • definiëren van softwarevereisten en ontwikkeling van software, inclusief ontwerpen, implementatie, unittesten, integratie en bug fixing;
  • kwaliteitscontrole, inclusief technische documentatie;
  • risicobeoordelingen en root cause analyses.

Nauwkeurig werken aan gezamenlijk resultaat 

Elekta levert producten voor de sterk gereguleerde medische sector. Dat betekent dat er veel nadruk ligt op processen en dat het belangrijk is dat je alles heel nauwkeurig en gedetailleerd documenteert. Als het om de behandeling van patiënten gaat, kunnen we ons natuurlijk geen fouten permitteren. Met jouw enthousiasme, analytisch vermogen en probleemoplossende instelling lever je een waardevolle bijdrage aan de gezamenlijke resultaten van het team: steeds betere producten waarmee zo’n 6.000 ziekenhuizen hun patiënten effectief kunnen behandelen én de realisatie van een succesvolle software-transitie. Binnen deze rol heb je veelvuldig contact met collega’s van andere afdelingen, zoals de testafdeling, productmanagers en projectmanagers, maar ook met andere (buitenlandse) vestigingen van Elekta. Vanzelfsprekend beschik je daarom over goede communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels. In ons team werken we met de scrum agile methodiek, dus het is fijn als je daar al enige ervaring in hebt. Verder vragen we:

  • ten minste een bachelor in een relevante richting, zoals Computer Science;
  • zo’n drie jaar werkervaring als Software Engineer, bij voorkeur met betrekking tot medische applicaties;
  • aantoonbare ervaring met Microsoft .NET Framework;
  • kennis van Microsoft Visual Studio en Azure DevOps en bij voorkeur ook van web front-end development applicaties zoals Angular, JavaScript, HTML of CSS en van ASP.NET Core.

Baan met ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden

Behalve dat je in deze baan belangrijk werk doet ter ondersteuning van de behandeling van kanker en hersenafwijkingen, is Elekta ook een heel prettig bedrijf om bij werken. We hechten veel waarde aan het welzijn van onze medewerkers en de werksfeer. Daarnaast bieden we je ook alle ruimte om jezelf vakinhoudelijk, maar ook je carrière verder te ontwikkelen. Op onze vestiging in Veenendaal of, als je daar interesse in hebt, internationaal. Wat wij verder bieden als arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn onder andere:

  • een vast contract en een marktconform maandsalaris;
  • vakantiegeld 8% over 12 maanden;
  • bonus bij behalen van de resultaten;
  • 25 vakantiedagen en 13 ADV-dagen per jaar;
  • reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer;
  • een hele actieve personeelsvereniging.

Interesse? Neem contact op!

Ben je geïnteresseerd in deze boeiende functie? Aarzel dan niet om contact met ons op te nemen.. Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Erik Sanders, Manager Software Development, erik.sanders@elekta.com. 

Het eerste sollicitatiegesprek zal online plaatsvinden, het tweede gesprek bij voorkeur bij Elekta in Veenendaal. Voor verdere informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure kun je contact opnemen met Arjette Poot, HR Business Partner, telefoon +31 (0)318 557133. Om te solliciteren gebruik je deze link!

Elekta is de trotse marktleider op het gebied van innovatieve apparatuur en software voor het verbeteren, verlengen en redden van levens van mensen met kanker en hersenafwijkingen. Onze geavanceerde, effectieve oplossingen zijn tot stand gekomen in samenwerking met klanten, en meer dan 6.000 ziekenhuizen wereldwijd werken met de technologie van Elekta. De behandeloplossingen en oncology technology portfolio’s zijn ontworpen om de levering van bestralingstherapie, radiochirurgie en brachytherapie te verbeteren en kostenefficiëntie in klinische workflows te bevorderen. Wereldwijd werken er 3.600 mensen aan deze oplossingen. Het hoofdkantoor van Elekta staat in Stockholm, Zweden. Elekta is een beursgenoteerd bedrijf op de NASDAQ in Stockholm.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
LTA Research and Exploration, an aerospace start-up, is seeking a motivated senior software engineer to help build an revolutionary ‘lighter than air’ flight vehicle. You will work within a dynamic engineering and design team to help plan, conceptualize, rapidly prototype, test and implement innovative solutions for the design, fabrication and assembly of large experimental flight vehicles. We believe in fast-cycle development and approach to flight systems development with the motto "build a little, test a little, learn a lot.”

This unique position allows for hand-on contributions through all phases of development, from concept to flight of an experimental aerospace vehicle. We are seeking a high energy, passionate software engineer to help develop the infrastructure, testing tools, and flight software.

Responsibilities and Duties

● Support the development of flight software for the integrated flight computer

● Design, code and integrate graphical pilot cockpit displays

● Develop and extend simulation of hardware components for SIL/HIL

● Perform and troubleshoot flight hardware bring-up

● Create ICDs and other technical documentation

Qualifications and Skills

● BS in computer science, computer engineering or related field

● 5+ years of experience in a similar role

● Proficient in C, C++ and Python

● Proficient with Git version control

● Experience with embedded development, real time operating systems

● Experience with serial data busses such as RS-485 and CAN

● Self-starter with history of project ownership

Preferred Qualifications

● Familiarity with NASA’s open source core Flight System (cFS)

● Experienced with ARM based micro controllers (STM32 or Teensy)

● Experience with Continuous Integration practices and tools

● Comfortable with CMake build tools

● Linux kernel development experience

● VxWorks 7

Lighter Than Air offers medical, dental, vision, and retirement benefits.

Lighter Than Air is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, veteran status or any other discriminatory factors prohibited by law.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Quick Take: Axios is a growth-stage startup dedicated to providing trustworthy, award-winning news content in an audience-first format. We are hiring an Infrastructure Engineer!

Why it Matters: By leveraging your Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) mindset and Infrastructure Engineering expertise, you will play a key role in our mission. You will design, build, and support tools, systems, and workflows that will amplify and enable the efforts of fellow engineers. You will help us optimize our stack and ultimately work toward making our systems faster, more efficient, and able to deal with massive volumes of traffic as we continue to launch worthy products into the world.

Go Deeper: In this role, you will make an impact on Axios through the following responsibilities:

Build standards, patterns, and tools that help engineers in other squads make effective use of infrastructure Consult with other squads in a SRE capacity to help leverage infrastructure effectively Configure and manage our software defined networking capabilities including VPCs, firewalls, and routing Audit and update AWS account and group policies Configure and maintain core shared services like Kubernetes clusters, databases, and CI/CD systems Be security-first when designing and evaluating solutions Help audit and harden our production monitoring and alerting systems Assist in crafting incident management and release coordination processes Mentor other team members through pair-programming and empathetic code review Understand the importance of creating and reviewing documentation

The Details: A DevOps mindset, the ability to ensure production performance at scale, and a passion for data engineering is the target mix. Ideal candidates will embody a collaborative and entrepreneurial spirit, a passion for Axios’ mission and have the following skills:

Experience building and maintaining AWS infrastructure Strong experience with Kubernetes is preferred Experience with CI/CD utilizing CircleCI Strong experience with monitoring systems like Prometheus and Grafana Experience configuring ingress routing and proxies like Traefik Experience writing scripts in a language like Python Experience using Terraform An understanding of business continuity and disaster recovery is a plus  Proactively seeking to make systems more efficient, faster and cheaper Fast learner with an ability to work collaboratively

Don’t forget:

Competitive salary Health insurance (100% paid for individuals, 75% for families) Primary caregiver 12-week paid leave 401K Generous vacation policy, plus company holidays Company equity Commuter and cell phone benefit A commitment to an open, inclusive, and diverse work culture Annual learning and development stipend

Additional pandemic-related benefits:

One mental health day per quarter $100 monthly work-from-home stipend Tele-mental health services  OneMedical membership, including tele-health services  Increased work flexibility for parents and caretakers  Access to the Axios “Family Fund”, which was created to allow employees to request financial support when facing financial hardship or emergencies  Weekly company-sponsored exercise and meditation classes  Virtual company-sponsored social events

title: Principal Software Engineer - Full Stack
description:
